timeline.message: adding original OSM identifier for convenient debugging
Atlas new check for roundabout missing tag
Atlas new check for roundabout missing tag
Merge latest changes from dev branch. And enable default check run

timeline.bodyText: Because you know you are dealing with the first edge section, you could just check that the in Edges contain an edge with the same OSM id. That would save you having to traverse along the whole Way.
timeline.author: Bentleysb

replies.author: vladlemberg

replies.bodyText: What about using edge.inEdges().stream().filter(e -> e.getOsmIdentifier() == edge.getOsmIdentifier()).count() == 1?
replies.author: Bentleysb

replies.bodyText: slick suggestion! need to add our favorite .filter(Edge::isMasterEdge) to make it complete. thanks a lot!!
replies.author: vladlemberg

timeline.bodyText: You use the way walker 3 times to collect the entire way (here, in buildOriginalOsmWayGeometry, and in intersectingWithMoreThan). While this is not a super expensive function, its repeated use can add up. It might be a bit better to call it once and then pass the edge set to each of the places that need it.
timeline.author: Bentleysb

replies.bodyText:
compilation time. tested against China data on local:
1 - use WayWalker in each method - 7,48 min (current)
2 - call WayWalker only ones and pass Set Edges to every method - 9,64 min
3 - make Set Edges static - 8,50 minutes.
replies.author: vladlemberg

timeline.author: Bentleysb

replies.bodyText: For tracking purposes, I think this would be better in a separate PR.
replies.author: Bentleysb

replies.bodyText: @Bentleysb This one has also been added. I think the branch is out of date with the dev branch.
replies.author: sayas01

replies.bodyText: @Bentleysb This has also been added in a prev PR. I think this branch is out of date with the dev branch.
replies.author: sayas01

timeline.bodyText: Is there a reason for this change? It appears to be redundant as the atlas identifier already contains the OSM id.
timeline.author: Bentleysb

replies.bodyText: yes. for debugging purpose its very convenient to copy original OSM id instead of playing with sectioned id in cases where original ID ends with 0 or small.
replies.author: vladlemberg

timeline.message: add MD doc file and check description in available checks.

timeline.bodyText: Could you update this description to include "missing junction=roundabout" ?
timeline.author: sayas01

timeline.bodyText: nit: asList could be replaced with Collections.singletonList as it has just one item in it.
timeline.author: sayas01

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't there be two separate config keys, "threshold.degrees.maximum" and "threshold.degrees.minimum" ?
timeline.author: sayas01

timeline.bodyText: nit: these could be combined to one statement  new OsmWayWalker(edge).collectEdges().stream() .filter(Edge::isMasterEdge).distinct() .sorted(Comparator.comparingLong(AtlasObject::getIdentifier)) .collect(Collectors.toList());
timeline.author: sayas01

timeline.bodyText: Please avoid single letter variable names.
timeline.author: sayas01

timeline.bodyText: Same as my prev comment. .filter(edge -> edge.getTag(ServiceTag.KEY).isEmpty())
timeline.author: sayas01

timeline.bodyText: Nice. Unrelated to this PR, I think we should update ReverseIdentifierFactory.getWaySectionIndex(atlas id) for this as it seems to be gaining popularity
timeline.author: seancoulter

timeline.bodyText: OSM Way walker should give you master edges by default, so no need to filter
timeline.author: seancoulter

timeline.bodyText: The way walker you used actually sorts by way section id (TreeSet) already so you could try using the default behavior. Ordering is defined in the WaySectionComparator
timeline.author: seancoulter

timeline.bodyText: Nice, would be cool to have this pulled out into the Edge class or something sometime down the line
timeline.author: seancoulter

timeline.bodyText: We could cache the waywalker call at the beginning of this method
timeline.author: seancoulter

replies.bodyText: Or potentially in the validCheckForObject method, as I see now the usage is out of this scope
replies.author: seancoulter

replies.bodyText:
yes. tested it, however it significantly slowing down the performance.
compilation time. tested against China data on local:
1 - use WayWalker in each method - 7,48 min (current)
2 - cache WayWalker and pass Set Edges to every method - 9,64 min
replies.author: vladlemberg

timeline.bodyText: @vladlemberg Just one more request to clean up this class a bit. You can import @TestAtlas.Node, @TestAtlas.Node etc. here.
timeline.author: sayas01
sayas01
